clinical_study.brief_title: Free Fatty Acid Metabolite Biomarkers for Cancer

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: Surgical removal of tumor at an early stage remains the primary treatment for most cancers. However, there is currently no reliable screening blood test for detection of lung, colon, or breast cancer. The Specific Aims are to: 1) assess the diagnostic accuracy of six FFA metabolites to detect lung and colon cancer in surgical patients; 2)determine the rate and extent to which FFA metabolites decrease over time after surgery for lung and colon cancer; and, 3)determine the positive and negative predictive values and overall test accuracy for diagnostic prostate and breast biopsies.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Estimate predictive values for each type of cancer.
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome for Specific Aim 1 will be the area under the ROC curve and 95% confidence interval for each metabolite.

primary_outcome.measure: Determine Biomarker reduction in blood samples
primary_outcome.description: One-week biomarker reduction from the preoperative value for each cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate predictive values for each type of cancer.
primary_outcome.description: To determine the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (i.e., AUC) predicting prostate and breast cancer for each FFA metabolite, as well as the diagnostic test parameters: sensitivity, specificity, positive and negative predictive values.

intervention.description: We will obtain daily blood samples from cancer patients enrolled under Specific Aim 1 while they remain hospitalized, and an additional sample one week after surgery.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood will be sampled for FFA metabolites

study_pop.textblock: Prostate cancer occurs only in men; conversely, breast cancer is almost exclusively a disease of women. The non-cancer control patients for each type of cancer will be of the same sex. We propose to study roughly comparable numbers of prostate and breast cancer patients (and controls). Colon and lung cancers occur at similar rates in men and women. We thus expect that about half of our total enrollment will be female.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- potential breast cancer
- patients who have early stages of breast cancer prior to surgery potential prostate cancer lung cancer colon cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1) Patients will be excluded from enrollment if they have severe liver disease (ALT three times the upper limit of normal). Patients will also be excluded who have taken aspirin or COX inhibitors within 48 hours of surgery. 2) Patients will be excluded if a pathologic diagnosis is already available,from a previous needle biopsy (coordinator will remain blinded). 3) Patients will be excluded have received pre-procedure chemotherapy or radiotherapy
